channel.title: Comments for The International Guild of Handhooking Rugmakers

item.title: Comment on Michele Wise Profile by Toni Jette
item.dc:creator: Toni Jette
item.description: I am looking for a place to buy wool for hooking. I have always lived near a wool hooker/teacher/dyer. I miss having someone near by. I would like to buy wool
item.content:encoded: I am looking for a place to buy wool for hooking. I have always lived near a wool hooker/teacher/dyer. I miss having someone near by. I would like to buy wool

item.title: Comment on Sinkut Mt from Nulki Shelley vanErp by Patricia O'Meara Thompson
item.dc:creator: Patricia O'Meara Thompson
item.description: Florence O'Meara was my Mother. She loved rug hooking and was known as the "Happy Hooker". She made many wonderful rugs and all her friends had at least one to remember her by. She had a wonderful life and lived until she was 98 yeas old in Vanderhoof. I was pleased to see your rug of Sinkut Mountain. Thank you, Patricia
item.content:encoded:
Florence O’Meara was my Mother. She loved rug hooking and was known as the “Happy Hooker”. She made many wonderful rugs and all her friends had at least one to remember her by. She had a wonderful life and lived until she was 98 yeas old in Vanderhoof.
I was pleased to see your rug of Sinkut Mountain. Thank you, Patricia

item.title: Comment on Fetching Cod, Dianne Warren Newfoundland Labrador, Canada original by jenna beattie
item.dc:creator: jenna beattie
item.description: Hi, My name is jenna beattie my Clothing Class at Prince of Wales Collegiate is doing research on Newfoundland Craftspeople. I was hoping you could answer a few short questions about your company and products. If that would be okay, please write back. Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
My name is jenna beattie my Clothing Class at Prince of Wales Collegiate is doing research on Newfoundland Craftspeople. I was hoping you could answer a few short questions about your company and products. If that would be okay, please write back.
Thanks

item.title: Comment on Wendy Halsall Profile by Alan Dorey
item.dc:creator: Alan Dorey
item.description: Wendy, Your choice of subject is spectacular! I fell in love with North West Indian art while visiting University of BC. These rugs of yours are now three of my favorites. I would love to see more.
item.content:encoded: Wendy, Your choice of subject is spectacular! I fell in love with North West Indian art while visiting University of BC. These rugs of yours are now three of my favorites. I would love to see more.

item.title: Comment on TheGloryOfRaceRocks, Michaele Freeman, BC Canada original by Toni Gatland
item.dc:creator: Toni Gatland
item.description: I’ve been wandering around Pinterest looking for tapestry inspiration and saw this. I thought “wow, this is so west coast...then I thought ...looks familiar....hmm a bit like Race Rocks... Then I looked further and saw that it is Race Rocks! Beautifully done. Are you in Nanaimo? I’m in Chemainus. Great depth and texture...
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been wandering around Pinterest looking for tapestry inspiration and saw this. I thought “wow, this is so west coast…then I thought …looks familiar….hmm a bit like Race Rocks… Then I looked further and saw that it is Race Rocks!
Beautifully done. Are you in Nanaimo? I’m in Chemainus. Great depth and texture…

item.title: Comment on Sinkut Mt from Nulki Shelley vanErp by Caroline lowther
item.dc:creator: Caroline lowther
item.description: I was in Nova Scotia two summers ago and fell in love with this art form. Have done nothing more then admire the work of others. Thinking after I finish...... I came across this piece of yours. I was absolutely delighted first with it, second with your subject matter. I grew up with the view of sinkut mountain. Saw through the frame of our living room window. I have two rugs from a woman named Florence o’meara who lived in vanderhoof. I didn’t totally appreciate them until I saw them as part of a wider movement. It is so wonderful that someone is still hooking there. Caroline lowther
item.content:encoded: I was in Nova Scotia two summers ago and fell in love with this art form. Have done nothing more then admire the work of others. Thinking after I finish…… I came across this piece of yours. I was absolutely delighted first with it, second with your subject matter. I grew up with the view of sinkut mountain. Saw through the frame of our living room window. I have two rugs from a woman named Florence o’meara who lived in vanderhoof. I didn’t totally appreciate them until I saw them as part of a wider movement. It is so wonderful that someone is still hooking there. Caroline lowther

item.title: Comment on Heather Ritchie by Lesley Close
item.dc:creator: Lesley Close
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/?attachment_id=1743%2F#comment-7449">Molly</a>.
Dear Molly, If you've read any of the other comments, you'll see that the information has not yet been released. The pages have been created to share with the board and the teachers. The full Triennial programme of classes will go out to members in the November edition of <em>Hooking Matters</em> and the password-protected pages will be made public soon afterwards. Sorry for the frustration - not long to wait now... Kind regards, Lesley
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Molly.

Dear Molly,
If you’ve read any of the other comments, you’ll see that the information has not yet been released. The pages have been created to share with the board and the teachers. The full Triennial programme of classes will go out to members in the November edition of Hooking Matters and the password-protected pages will be made public soon afterwards.
Sorry for the frustration – not long to wait now…
Kind regards,
Lesley

item.title: Comment on Monday at Triennial by Lesley Close
item.dc:creator: Lesley Close
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/10/05/monday-at-triennial/#comment-7405">Lynda Kinnard</a>.
Hi Lynda, We would love to see the four of you in Swaledale next October and yes - you must be members to attend the Triennial. We will be releasing full information about the event, including full details of the workshops and the costs, in the next TIGHR Newsletter (due out in November) and, if you join soon, you will be able to get the facts before non-members. If not, keep an eye on these pages: soon after members get the information, it will be released to the world! With kind regards, Lesley
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lynda Kinnard.

Hi Lynda,
We would love to see the four of you in Swaledale next October and yes – you must be members to attend the Triennial.
We will be releasing full information about the event, including full details of the workshops and the costs, in the next TIGHR Newsletter (due out in November) and, if you join soon, you will be able to get the facts before non-members. If not, keep an eye on these pages: soon after members get the information, it will be released to the world!
With kind regards,
Lesley

item.title: Comment on 2018 Swaledale Triennial dates! by Lesley Close
item.dc:creator: Lesley Close
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/04/04/2018-swaledale-triennial-dates/#comment-7154">Pat Seeberger</a>.
Hi Pat, We will be publishing full details of the Triennial events in the November issue of <em>Hooking Matters</em>. Shortly afterwards, full information will appear on the TIGHR website. We look forward to meeting you and your husband in Swaledale - there will be events for non-participants too! Regards, Lesley
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Pat Seeberger.

Hi Pat,
We will be publishing full details of the Triennial events in the November issue of Hooking Matters. Shortly afterwards, full information will appear on the TIGHR website.
We look forward to meeting you and your husband in Swaledale – there will be events for non-participants too!
Regards,
Lesley

item.title: Comment on 2018 Swaledale Triennial dates! by Lesley Close
item.dc:creator: Lesley Close
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/04/04/2018-swaledale-triennial-dates/#comment-6986">Deb Johnson</a>.
Hi Deb, Don't worry! I made a mistake when I said Easter 2017 - it should have been 2018, of course! Please feel free to contact the membership chair for further details about joining. Kind regards, Lesley
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Deb Johnson.

Hi Deb,
Don’t worry! I made a mistake when I said Easter 2017 – it should have been 2018, of course!
Please feel free to contact the membership chair for further details about joining.
Kind regards,
Lesley
